intro: Emilia prenanthoidea, commonly known as the Mexican daisy, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Emilia prenanthoidea typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
